speaker: Frasier
text: Hello?

speaker: Carlos
text: [_v.o_] Dr. Crane?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, who's this?

speaker: Carlos
text: Dr. Kaufmann.  Bob Kaufmann of the National Psychotherapy Institute.  Oh my gosh, it's six-fifteen in the morning your time.  I hope I didn't wake you.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, I was up. [_sits up_] Er, where did you say you were calling from?

speaker: Carlos
text: The National Psychotherapy Institute... _CUT TO: KACL  We now see that it is not Dr. Kaufmann on the phone.  Frasier is actually on the receiving end of a prank call from KACL's new morning team, "Carlos And The Chicken."  Throughout this scene we swap between KACL studios and Frasier's bedroom._

speaker: Carlos
text: ...in Saddle River, New Jersey.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, of course.  What can I do for you?

speaker: Carlos
text: Oh, for Pete's sake.  No one called you?  You won our Radio Therapist of the Year Award.  Congratulations.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes it in_] Well, thank you.  Of course, the work itself is honor enough.

speaker: Carlos
text: Thank you!  And I'm sorry about the mix-up.  The problem is we're going to need some pictures of you so we can get started on the statue.

speaker: Frasier
text: Statue?

speaker: Carlos
text: For our Hall of Thinkers. [_aside_] Angie, he never got the packet!

speaker: Frasier
text: Is there anything I can do?

speaker: Carlos
text: Well, it's a little late now, but maybe if you describe your body we could get started on the preliminary carving.  The sculptor's right here.  Fortunately we got Herr Gustav Brumhalt.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my.

speaker: Chicken
text: Dr. Crane, please, _ja_?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, this is Dr. Crane speaking.  Herr Brumhalt, may I say, it's quite an honor.

speaker: Chicken
text: _Ja, Ja, Ja._ We have your face, very handsome, but I need you to describe your body.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, of course.  Er, six foot one, medium build, broad shoulders, sublimely proportioned...

speaker: Chicken
text: _Ja, das ist gut, Ja._ But before I order my marble I need to describe your, how do I say this, where you sit?  _Ja_?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, my posterior, yeah well, that's a little sensitive, isn't it? [_laughs_]

speaker: Chicken
text: Oh, you don't want to tell me, I understand, it's a big one. Angie, order the big marble, please.

speaker: Frasier
text: Please put Dr. Kaufmann back on.

speaker: Chicken
text: No, I have a better idea.  Why don't you send us a picture of your [_reverts to normal voice_] hindquarters and send it into KACL's new morning team...

speaker: Chicken/Carlos
text: Carlos And The Chicken!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_takes it in_] Dr. Kaufmann?  Angie? _CUT TO:  Scene Two - Frasier's Apartment. Frasier enters from his room that morning as Daphne does the same. Frasier is fuming, Daphne is trying to contain her laughter._

speaker: Frasier
text: Morning!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_nearly laughing_] Good morning, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: You won't believe what just happened to me!  I was the victim of a radio prank.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, how terrible! [_swallows her laughter_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's a sad day when getting a man to describe his own behind passes as humor.

speaker: Frasier
text: You heard the whole thing, didn't you!

speaker: Daphne
text: [_comes back with coffee_] _Ja!_ I'm sorry, Dr. Crane, but they can be funny.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's all right, Daphne.  "Carlos and the Chicken" are the sort of performers who keep popping up on the radio these days.  So-called humorists who rely on cruel pranks and scatological references.  Well, I suppose that's the sort of thing that passes for entertainment these days.  You know, perhaps it's just a generational thing.

speaker: Martin
text: Man, they got you good!  The Chicken was on fire!  What a great bit!

speaker: Daphne
text: Yeah, I think it will be bit of the day.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_gets up_] I'm going back to bed.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, wait a minute, can you get me a tape of the show?

speaker: Frasier
text: What on earth for?

speaker: Martin
text: How often do you get to hear your son on the radio?!

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm on the radio everyday! _He storms off to his room.  FADE OUT  Scene Three - Caf e Nervosa. Frasier orders his coffee at the counter and meets Roz at a table. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello Roz, I suppose you heard about my unscheduled appearance on KACL's new morning show.

speaker: Roz
text: No, what happened?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, the less said about it, the better.

speaker: Roz
text: Come on Frasier, why don't you pull up a couple of chairs and tell me about it? [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Was everyone in Seattle listening at six in the morning?

speaker: Roz
text: Did they do it at six?  I heard the replay at eight.

speaker: Waitress
text: [_bringing Frasier's coffee_] I heard it at nine-fifteen.

speaker: Roz
text: Congratulations, you were bit of the day!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I thought the entire thing was rude and childish.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, you're just mad because you fell for it.  Come on, Frasier, "Hall of Thinkers"?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, it's not such a bad idea.  In a society where we glorify our athletes and rock musicians, I thought maybe we should... [_then_] Well, it was early. _Meanwhile, Kenny, Carlos and the Chicken enter and sit down at the opposite table.  Roz notices them._

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, that's them over there with Kenny.  Wow!  The Chicken's a lot cuter than he is on his billboard. Of course, he's not squatting in a feather suit trying to hatch Carlos's head.

speaker: Frasier
text: Do you know, I think I might just go over there and introduce myself.

speaker: Roz
text: I don't know what you're thinking, but don't.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm just going to go over there and let them know that what they did today was completely unacceptable.

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier, I know guys like this.  Once they know they can rattle you, they never stop.  Just take your lumps and laugh it off.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm perfectly capable of laughing it off, I just want to let them know that I don't appreciate being made the punch line at my own station.  I'm going to go over there and tell them from now on, I don't want any part of their shenanigans.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh God, _please_ don't say "shenanigans!"

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Kenny.  I believe introductions are in order.

speaker: Kenny
text: Oh, right, Dr. Frasier Crane, this is the Chicken and Carlos.

speaker: Carlos
text: Ah, ah...

speaker: Kenny
text: What?

speaker: Carlos
text: We're actually called "Carlos and the Chicken."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, nice to meet you boys.  About this morning...

speaker: Kenny
text: Whoa, Whoa, Whoa, I don't want to see any feathers flying here. [_laughs_] Just kidding.

speaker: Carlos
text: Dr. Crane, I hope we didn't go too far.  We love your show.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really, you're listeners?

speaker: Carlos
text: Oh yeah, we're big fans.  And you know, the last thing we want to do is step on your toes.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well you know, you do tread a fine line with your style of comedy, but perhaps you can be excused for stomping on it rather exuberantly on your first day.  Just keep in mind in the future that this station does have a certain pecking order. [_laughs_]

speaker: Carlos
text: We totally get it, Dr. Crane, it felt wrong when we did it.

speaker: Chicken
text: Sure did, sure you're not upset or anything?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, no harm, no foul. [_laughs_]

speaker: Chicken
text: It's great meeting you, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Likewise, boys.  Hey, call me Frasier, but don't call me at home.

speaker: Carlos
text: And Dr. Crane: we're listening!

speaker: Roz
text: Is it over?  I couldn't look.

speaker: Frasier
text: For God's sake, Roz, have a little faith in me.  After all, I do reason with people for a living.  It's all settled. You know, they're good kids, really, quite sensible actually.

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, if you go for beer-belching frat boy types - which I do, was the Chicken wearing a wedding ring?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I really did overreact this morning.  After all, it was kind of cute, I suppose. [_laughs_] "Hall of Thinkers." Never let it be said that Frasier Crane is the kind of man who is incapable of laughing at himself.

speaker: Waitress
text: These are for you.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_laughs_] Yes, I see, some patron has sent me some sticky buns. [_to caf e_] Very funny.  Very funny, indeed.

speaker: Waitress
text: You ordered those, sir.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, so I did, thank you. _Frasier tucks in.  FADE TO:_ **TAKE THAT, ALFALFA** _Scene Four - Frasier's Apartment. Martin is on the phone to his friend.  Frasier is drinking coffee in his dressing gown.  Daphne is also hanging around.  The doorbell sounds._

speaker: Martin
text: No kidding.  He's flying you to Las Vegas for the fight? [_so Frasier can hear_] That's a great son you've got there, Duke.

speaker: Daphne
text: Good morning, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Niles
text: Hello, Daphne, Dad.  Frasier, I thought you might like to join me.  I'm going down to Abigail's to have my crepe pans re-seasoned.

speaker: Frasier
text: Gosh, I'd love to, Niles, but I've just drawn myself a nice herbal bath.

speaker: Martin
text: [_laughs_] No, no, it's just Daphne, she's watching PBS.  Okay, I'll talk to you later, Duke. [_hangs up_] Does the whole world have to know what goes on in this house?

speaker: Frasier
text: Help yourself to some coffee, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, how do you know it's time to have your crepe pans re-seasoned, anyway?

speaker: Niles
text: It can be confusing.  But this may help: "Saucepans in summer, crepe pans in fall, when winter's upon us, there's food for us all."

speaker: Martin
text: Whoever it is, I am not home, I am not here!

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Chicken
text: [_v.o with accent_] Is Dr. Crane there?

speaker: Niles
text: No, actually he's taking a bath.

speaker: Chicken
text: Who's this?

speaker: Niles
text: This is his brother, Niles.

speaker: Chicken
text: Okay, well this is the building superintendent. _CUT TO: KACL. Carlos and the Chicken are on the air, and Chicken is navigating their latest crank call._

speaker: Chicken
text: I'm in the bathroom just below his and I think the pipes are getting corroded.  Is your brother putting anything unusual in his bath?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not exactly sure what he puts in his bath.  Better let me ask him.

speaker: Martin
text: I smell a bit.

speaker: Daphne
text: Put the radio on. _Martin does.  CUT TO: Frasier's Bathroom. Meanwhile, Frasier is enjoying his bath whilst singing "I'm in the Mood for Love."  Niles enters._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm in the mood for love...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier-

speaker: Frasier
text: Simply because you're near me...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, what do you put in your bath water?

speaker: Frasier
text: You know very well it's a proprietary blend, Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: No, no, no, it's your super.  There's something corroding the pipes in the unit below you, he thinks it may be something in your tub. [_hands him the phone_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to phone_] Hello, yes, I'm sure it's not my fault but if you insist, I use... [_waits for Niles to exit_] ...jasmine, lavender, rose hips and a little Tahitian Vanilla.

speaker: Chicken
text: Yeah well, it sounds okay.  Boy, with a bath like that I bet the ladies sure go for you though, huh?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes well, love does enter through the nose.

speaker: Chicken
text: Hey you know, the neighbors down here have been complaining about a little sound bleed-through.  I think we got a bad tile, I sure would like to check it.  I heard you sing into the phone earlier.  You think you could, I don't know, do it again?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right. _Frasier begins singing "I'm in the Mood for Love" again. CUT TO: KACL._

speaker: Chicken
text: Yeah, that's great.  I definitely heard some bleed-through. You know, I could isolate the tile if you could just walk around a little bit... [_Carlos bounces in his chair_] or maybe you know, if you could stomp around that would be great.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stomp around?

speaker: Chicken
text: Yeah, well look, if it's too much trouble I could send my assistant, Jimmy, up to stomp around.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, please.  You just leave Jimmy where he is. I certainly don't need an audience while I'm singing in the bathtub.

speaker: Chicken
text: I really appreciate this.  We'll get it all cleared up in a jiffy.  Thanks a lot, Dr. Crane.

speaker: Frasier
text: Just wait a second and I'll tell you when I'm ready.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm ready.  Here goes. _Frasier, whilst singing his song, jumps around the bathroom producing a farce._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm in the mood for love, [_stomps his foot_] Simply because you're near me, [_starts jumping around_] Funny but...

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on radio_] When you're near meeeeee.... _She sinks her head down onto the steering wheel.  CUT BACK TO: the bathroom._

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm in the mood for love...

speaker: Chicken
text: Oh my God!  The whole ceiling's falling down.  Ow!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, good Lord! [_retreats and sits on edge of tub_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, be careful, the whole ceiling's caving in.

speaker: Chicken
text: Hey listen, I think we found out what the problem is: it's that _humongous_ ass of yours!

speaker: Carlos
text: Listeners, "Carlos and the Chicken" are offering one thousand dollars for the best picture of Frasier Crane's humongous ass for our website. _Then they start playing a theme song that goes "Frasier Crane's humongous ass contest."  Niles looks on to an appalled and despairing Frasier._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hangs up_] Oh, dear God!

speaker: Niles
text: Now, now, it won't get you down for long.  You've always had a thick skin. [_starts to giggle_] Unless that Tahitian Vanilla softened you up a bit...

speaker: Frasier
text: GET OUT! _Niles runs out.  End of Act One.  Act Two._  **THE UMBRELLA POLICY**  _Scene One - Frasier's Apartment. It is another morning in the Crane household.  Martin is sat in his chair, wearing his dressing gown and reading his paper.  Frasier bursts in with a sweater tied around his waist to cover his backside. As he enters, we can see camera flashes outside.  Frasier is carrying a medicine bottle._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_enters_] Leave me alone!  For God's sake, have some respect.

speaker: Martin
text: Was that Mrs. Kurdsmen?

speaker: Frasier
text: She dropped her medication in the hallway.  As I stooped to pick it up, out came her camera like an assassin's blade. Well, if she wants to control those blood clots, she'll cough up that film! [_puts the pills on the cabinet_]

speaker: Martin
text: You're really getting riled up.

speaker: Frasier
text: I certainly am.

speaker: Martin
text: Come on, they're just pranks.  Back in the force, we used to do stuff like this all the time.  We'd fill a guy's hat with shaving cream or nail his shoes to the floor.  Sometimes we'd get a guy dead drunk and leave him in a drawer in the morgue! [_laughs_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, Dad, I might have been able to laugh it off if all of Seattle hadn't started stalking me with cameras! _Frasier looks through the spy-hole in the door.  He then quickly opens the door and pulls a surprised Niles inside._

speaker: Frasier
text: Quickly Niles, inside, come on! [_slams the door_]

speaker: Niles
text: Why didn't you hold the elevator?  Didn't you hear me shouting?

speaker: Frasier
text: That was you?  I'm sorry, Niles, I was afraid you were trying to get a picture of my butt!

speaker: Niles
text: How exciting to be present at the birth of a new phobia. [_gives Frasier a look_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm talking about Carlos and the Chicken.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, their little contest.  I can't believe anyone's taking that seriously.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, they won't be for much longer.  I've decided it's time to fight back.  I was up to all hours last night crafting my response to those two idiots.  I believe I have arrived at a masterful rebuttal.

speaker: Martin
text: I'm not sure you want to call it your reBUTTal. _Frasier and Niles cross to the table where quotations books are laid across the table along with Frasier's speech._

speaker: Niles
text: I see your "Bartlett's" is out.  You're not pulling any punches!

speaker: Frasier
text: Hardly.  I go in swinging with La Rochefoucauld: "If we had no faults of our own, we would not take so much pleasure in noticing those of others."

speaker: Niles
text: [_boxing-match style_] Ouch!

speaker: Frasier
text: And when I've knocked them reeling, I go in with a jab of Dorothy Parker: "Wit has truth in it, wise-cracking is merely calisthenics with words."

speaker: Niles
text: Pow!

speaker: Frasier
text: And when they're bloody and against the ropes, I go in with the kill - [_shadow-boxing_] Twain, Wilde, Twain, Twain, Mencken!

speaker: Niles
text: It's not a fight, it's an execution! _As they laugh and caper enthusiastically, Martin comes over to the table._

speaker: Martin
text: You know Frasier, if you go and read that on the air you're going to set yourself up for a year of abuse.  You know, this kind of thing is probably the reason why these guys started picking on you in the first place.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Dad, what exactly are you saying?  That I somehow managed to bring all this misery on myself?

speaker: Martin
text: No, I'm not saying that, just... well, have you ever wondered why these bullies have always kind of zeroed in on you two?

speaker: Niles
text: No, we don't wonder why, we know the reason:

speaker: Frasier/Niles
text: Jealousy!

speaker: Martin
text: Okay, so there's a little bit of that too.  But you know, you kinda give people the impression that you're... above them.

speaker: Frasier
text: Pish-tosh!

speaker: Niles
text: Poppycock!

speaker: Niles
text: Morning, Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, do you think we're snobby, superior and condescending?

speaker: Daphne
text: That's it!  I'm getting my door sound-proofed.

speaker: Martin
text: See what I mean?  People think you're stuffy.  You know, with your opera parties, and your wine parties, and your seasoned crepe pans.

speaker: Frasier
text: In my defense, Niles is the only one who has ever seasoned his crepe pans.

speaker: Niles
text: Which is the precisely why I've had the same set since the ninth grade, thank you very much.

speaker: Martin
text: My point is, you guys could never resist putting on airs. Even when you were in junior high, you used to love that TV  program, "The Avengers."  You used to run all over the neighborhood pretending you were that guy with the umbrella... Steve.

speaker: Frasier
text: Steed!

speaker: Niles
text: [_rolls his eyes_] Dad!

speaker: Frasier
text: There were worse role models.  Steed was dapper and witty. When anyone tried to give him grief, he gave them a sound thrashing with the umbrella.

speaker: Martin
text: Well, that's great, admire him if you want.  But did you have to run through the neighborhood in bowler hats?  I mean, you were just begging to get beat up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come to think of it, it was rather a rough summer that year, wasn't it?

speaker: Niles
text: I remember getting a chin strap so the bowler wouldn't fall off when I ran.

speaker: Martin
text: And all that did was make you look like Elizabeth Taylor in "National Velvet."  My point is, if you go down to the station and read that over the air, then you might as well go down there in a great big bowler hat.  I mean, people are never going to let you forget it. _"[The bowler] should never be worn abroad, never by foreigners, and Americans who attempt to do so should be fined." -- Hardy Amies, designer  Daphne has re-entered with coffee._

speaker: Daphne
text: You know, it's funny hearing you talk about "The Avengers." My first Halloween in America, I went to a party dressed as Mrs. Peel.  Head-to-toe in that skintight black leather catsuit. [_Niles looks up_] Come to think of it, I still have it somewhere, and Halloween's coming up.

speaker: Martin
text: Catsuit, huh? [_referring to Eddie who has just come in_] Better not let this guy hear you talking about that, he'll go nuts.

speaker: Niles
text: I would not! [_sees Eddie_] ...be surprised if he did! Ho-ho-ho. [_strokes Eddie_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me. [_answers_] Hello?  Why, Roz - yes, just calm down. No, no, I'm not listening.  Hang on a second. _Frasier turns on the radio.  "Carlos and the Chicken" have put together a tape which sounds like Roz and Frasier having sex - voice clips from the radio show laid over background sounds of moaning and grunting. Frasier is horrified._

speaker: Frasier
text: [_on radio_] Roz!  Oh, dear God!

speaker: Carlos
text: [_on radio_] I think we're going to have to throw a bucket of water on those two.

speaker: Chicken
text: [_on radio_] Roz and Frasier stopped around for a quick hello, next thing you know, they're getting it on in the booth!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: [_on radio_] Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz!

speaker: Roz
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Do we have time to squeeze in one more?

speaker: Roz
text: Plenty of time, Frasier.  Two more minutes.

speaker: Carlos
text: You know, for a man carrying around a good fifty extra pounds of ass, Frasier Crane has got unbelievable stamina.  Frasier, where do you get your energy?

speaker: Frasier
text: Lavender, rose hips and a little Tahitian Vanilla.

speaker: Carlos
text: Oh my God, they're changing positions.  I've never seen that one before.

speaker: Frasier
text: Love does enter through the nose. _Frasier turns it off.  Martin, Daphne and Niles can't contain their laughter._

speaker: Frasier
text: Call you back, Roz. [_hangs up_] I'm going down there.

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier...

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, don't try to talk me out of this, I'm going to teach those two a lesson, they'll not soon forget. [_grabs speech_] Where's my umbrella?

speaker: Martin
text: Oh no, not that again!  Not the umbrella, I'm begging you!

speaker: Frasier
text: It's raining! _Frasier grabs his umbrella and exits the apartment to an array of camera flashes._

speaker: Frasier
text: No!  No, stop it! _FADE TO:  Scene Two - KACL Radio Station. Frasier storms through the double doors into the corridor outside the studio where "Carlos and the Chicken" are live on air.  Frasier bumps into an equally angry Roz._

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, what are you doing here?

speaker: Roz
text: I am getting revenge, that's what!  These guys are going down! Did you hear the disgusting, vile things they said about me?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just the part about us having sex.

speaker: Roz
text: Exactly!  And now they've got a photo contest about me now, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, a thousand dollars for a shot of your behind?  Sorry.

speaker: Roz
text: No, it's fifty bucks and a six-pack.  And there were seven winners before I even left the house.  Frasier, what shall we do?  Slash their tires, should we crack their windshields?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I was thinking of a more direct approach, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Oh, I'm down with that too!  Next commercial, I'll get the Chicken, you take the big guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, that's not it and you know it, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: I knew you'd say that.  Fine, I'll take the big guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, Roz.  Listen to yourself, you're lusting for blood like a barbarian.  I've a more civilized approach in mind. I have composed a speech!

speaker: Roz
text: A speech?  Well, unless you plan to roll it up and cram it down their throats, what good is that gonna do?

speaker: Frasier
text: Just watch me.

speaker: Roz
text: No, Frasier, they're never going to stop making fun of you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Roz, I don't care.  I just figured out something, you know, maybe you can't stop bullies from attacking you, but the only way they win is if they change who you are, and I'll tell you something, let them do their worst.  They will not knock the bowler off of this head!

speaker: Roz
text: [_opens the door_] What does that mean?! _Frasier enters the booth and shuts Roz outside.  Carlos and the Chicken react to him._

speaker: Carlos
text: Holy Cow, look who just walked into the booth: Frasier Crane, the automatic sex pilot.

speaker: Chicken
text: What's up, love doctor?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I think you two know what's up.  There's only so much I can take, there's only so much anyone can take from a juvenile comic and his straight man.  I believe it was La Rochefoucauld who first said...

speaker: Chicken
text: Listen to me, I'll take my straight man over your sex- starved producer any day, my friend.

speaker: Roz
text: [_bursts in_] Nobody...

speaker: Carlos
text: Hey, wait a second, I'm not your straight man.  If anything, I'm the funny one.

speaker: Chicken
text: Let's not start with this again, okay?

speaker: Carlos
text: You're the one who just started it, on the air!

speaker: Frasier
text: It was La Rochefoucauld that first said...

speaker: Carlos
text: You always do this.

speaker: Chicken
text: Hey Carlos, the therapist said not to use the word "always."

speaker: Carlos
text: I just wish you could say I was as funny as you are.

speaker: Chicken
text: Now, I wish I could say that too, but who does all the funny voices?

speaker: Frasier
text: La Rochefoucauld once said-

speaker: Carlos
text: If I'm so unfunny, how come I get all the solo gigs?

speaker: Chicken
text: Oh, now I'm laughing, ha-ha!

speaker: Carlos
text: Don't believe me?  Ask our agent!

speaker: Chicken
text: You talked to Zachary behind my back.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, if I could just get a word in...

speaker: Carlos
text: I'm going.

speaker: Chicken
text: Go ahead, be my guest.

speaker: Carlos
text: Great, because I don't need you and I don't need "Carlos and the Chicken."

speaker: Chicken
text: Oh, really?  Well, best of luck, funny boy!

speaker: Carlos
text: Same to you, Dwayne! [_exits_]

speaker: Chicken
text: Hey, that's not cool.

speaker: Frasier
text: Chicken!  I believe it was La Rochefoucauld, the great French thinker...

speaker: Chicken
text: Hey, give it a rest, double-wide, I went to grad school too. And P.S.: It's pronounced [_different_] "La Rochefoucald."

speaker: Frasier
text: [_livid_] That's it!  Nobody corrects my French pronunciation, you son of a...!

speaker: Kenny
text: [_calls after_] Chicken! [_to Frasier_] Did you have to be so vicious?

speaker: Frasier
text: Me?!

speaker: Kenny
text: We got dead air, take over! [_exits_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, right. [_sits at microphone_] This is Dr. Frasier Crane, I'll be filling in for the next hour of the morning zoo with my own particular brand of zany antics. [_thinks, then_] Let's see, em, you know there was a fabulous cartoon in the recent "New Yorker". Let me see if I can describe it for you...
